decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to use cards that mill the opponent's library, causing them to discard cards and potentially lose the game by running out of cards to draw from. It also includes cards that can exile cards from the opponent's graveyard to disrupt their potential strategies. The deck aims to control the game through milling and disruption, while also having some removal options to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize its consistency in executing its game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The key strategy is to control the game by countering important spells, removing threats from the board, and generating card advantage. The deck also includes alternate win conditions in the form of planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. Additionally, the deck utilizes land disruption with Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge to slow down the opponent's mana development.

Utilize aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. Utilize cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter to disrupt your opponent's mana base, while utilizing cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Thought-Knot Seer to remove key cards from your opponent's hand. Use Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play quickly and efficiently, while utilizing Eldrazi Displacer to flicker your own creatures for additional value. Overall, the deck seeks to control the board state and apply pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful and low-cost creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler to quickly pressure the opponent's life total. With a strong mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to control the game and protect its threats. The deck also has efficient removal spells like Fatal Push, Terminate, and Dismember to deal with opposing threats. By aggressively deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a combination of combat damage and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana and quickly assemble Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, dealing massive amounts of damage to the opponent's creatures or directly to their face. The deck also includes some disruption and card draw elements to help ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Additionally, cards like Hour of Promise and Prismatic Omen help to further enhance the deck's ability to deal damage with Valakut.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up life loss with cards like Death's Shadow, Street Wraith, and Thoughtseize in order to reduce your life total and pump up your Death's Shadow. With a mix of disruption like Inquisition of Kozilek and removal like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, you can control the board while simultaneously lowering your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Grim Flayer to maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure.

This deck focuses on aggressively lowering your life total to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the battlefield. It utilizes cheap spells to disrupt your opponent's game plan while fueling graveyard synergies to quickly deploy threats. The deck aims to have a fast and efficient game plan, using tempo plays and removal to control the board and close out the game with a single massive Death's Shadow. By carefully managing your life total and resources, you can overwhelm your opponent with a lethal combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, backed up by removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional removal and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board while pushing through damage quickly with its aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to cast powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, while also having access to versatile removal options like Oblivion Stone and Warping Wail. The deck utilizes card advantage with Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to find key pieces and control the game through heavy hitters like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent with high-impact threats and removal spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly using Eldrazi Temple and Urza lands to get out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher early in the game. It also disrupts the opponent's strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter while maintaining card advantage with Expedition Map and Sea Gate Wreckage. The deck can also handle various threats with removal spells like Dismember and board wipes like All Is Dust. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures while controlling the battlefield.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also utilizes cards like Walking Ballista and Karn Liberated to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust provide additional disruption while Expedition Map helps find the necessary lands. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Merfolk creatures that benefit from various lords and tribal synergies. By utilizing cards like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, the deck aims to pump up its creatures' power and toughness, while also utilizing disruption and tempo plays like Harbinger of the Tides and Spreading Seas to control the game. With a mix of creature buffs, card draw, and disruptive elements, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other big threats like Primeval Titan, then comboing off with Scapeshift to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn. It utilizes cards like Prismatic Omen and Hour of Promise to ensure Valakut can consistently deal damage whenever a land enters the battlefield. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of burn damage from Valakut triggers.

The deck is built around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a ton of mana quickly. It aims to control the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their threats, and eventually locking them out of the game with cards like Mindslaver. It also has the ability to search for key cards with Expedition Map and Tolaria West. The deck utilizes big threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Karn Liberated, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to close out the game once it has established control.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the Eldrazi creatures to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. By combining powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher with disruptive cards like Path to Exile and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Collective Brutality provide additional versatility and support, allowing the deck to adapt to different situations and match-ups.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells in order to apply pressure on opponents quickly and efficiently. By utilizing cards like Karn Liberated, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer, along with mana acceleration from Eldrazi Temple and Urza's lands, this deck aims to overpower opponents with large threats early in the game. Additionally, cards like Chalice of the Void and Relic of Progenitus help disrupt opponent's game plans, while Expedition Map and other utility lands provide consistency and flexibility.
